metadata.title: Technological change and wage premiums amongst high-skilled labour

relevance.topic: Technological change and wage premiums amongst high-skilled labour
relevance.relevance: The study examines the impact of the steam engine on wages of high-skilled seamen, providing insights into labor displacement and wage changes due to technological advancements.

design.sample_characteristics: The sample consists of Swedish sailors from the Seamen's House documents, covering 9592 different individuals.

dependent_variables.wage_changes: High-skilled seamen on steam-powered vessels received an approximately 25% wage premium compared to those on sailing vessels.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Period of economic growth and transition from sailing ships to steam-powered vessels.
historical_context.institutional_context: The Seamen's House in Sweden collected data on sailors for military use, providing a rich historical dataset.

outcomes.main_findings: High-skilled seamen on steam-powered vessels received a wage premium, which declined over time. The premium was approximately 25% initially and decreased to 16% after controlling for job changes and individual characteristics.
outcomes.conclusions: The study concludes that technological advancements, such as the steam engine, led to wage premiums for high-skilled labor, supporting the hypothesis that technology increases wages for workers performing abstract tasks.
